alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 28 at 1:00PM PDT until March 30 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM WEDNESDAY TO 4 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches possible above 5000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Riverside County Mountains. * WHEN...From 10 AM Wednesday to 4 PM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow level will rise to around 6500 feet Wednesday morning, then fall to 3500 to 4000 feet late Wednesday night and rise to 4000 to 4500 feet Thursday. The most significant snowfall is expected above 5000 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
